005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.DynamicContext;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.DynamicMetapathException;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ISequence;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.InvalidTypeMetapathException;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathException;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.library.FnData;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.TypeSystem;
016import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IAnyAtomicItem;
017import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IAnyUriItem;
018import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IStringItem;
019
020import java.util.ArrayList;
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.EnumSet;
023import java.util.Iterator;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Objects;
026import java.util.Set;
027import java.util.stream.Stream;
028
029import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
030import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
031
032/**
033 * Provides a concrete implementation of a function call executor.
034 */
035public class DefaultFunction
036    extends AbstractFunction {
037  // private static final Logger logger =
038  // LogManager.getLogger(AbstractFunction.class);
039
040  @NonNull
041  private final Set<FunctionProperty> properties;
042  @NonNull
043  private final ISequenceType result;
044  @NonNull
045  private final IFunctionExecutor handler;
046
047  /**
048   * Construct a new function signature.
049   *
050   * @param name
051   *          the name of the function
052   * @param properties
053   *          the characteristics of the function
054   * @param arguments
055   *          the argument signatures or an empty list
056   * @param result
057   *          the type of the result
058   * @param handler
059   *          the handler to call to execute the function
060   */
061  @SuppressWarnings({ "null", "PMD.LooseCoupling" })
062  DefaultFunction(
063      @NonNull String name,
064      @NonNull String namespace,
065      @NonNull EnumSet<FunctionProperty> properties,
066      @NonNull List<IArgument> arguments,
067      @NonNull ISequenceType result,
068      @NonNull IFunctionExecutor handler) {
069    super(name, namespace, arguments);
070    this.properties = Collections.unmodifiableSet(properties);
071    this.result = result;
072    this.handler = handler;
073  }
074
075  @Override
076  public Set<FunctionProperty> getProperties() {
077    return properties;
078  }
079
080  @Override
081  public ISequenceType getResult() {
082    return result;
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Converts arguments in an attempt to align with the function's signature.
087   *
088   * @param function
089   *          the function
090   * @param parameters
091   *          the argument parameters
092   * @return the converted argument list
093   */
094  @NonNull
095  public static List<ISequence<?>> convertArguments(
096      @NonNull IFunction function,
097      @NonNull List<? extends ISequence<?>> parameters) {
098    @NonNull List<ISequence<?>> retval = new ArrayList<>(parameters.size());
099
100    Iterator<IArgument> argumentIterator = function.getArguments().iterator();
101    IArgument argument = null;
102    for (ISequence<?> parameter : parameters) {
103      if (argumentIterator.hasNext()) {
104        argument = argumentIterator.next();
105      } else if (!function.isArityUnbounded()) {
106        throw new InvalidTypeMetapathException(
107            null,
108            String.format("argument signature doesn't match '%s'", function.toSignature()));
109      }
110
111      assert argument != null;
112      assert parameter != null;
113
114      retval.add(convertArgument(argument, parameter));
115    }
116    return retval;
117  }
118
119  @NonNull
120  private static ISequence<?> convertArgument(
121      @NonNull IArgument argument,
122      @NonNull ISequence<?> parameter) {
123    // apply occurrence
124    ISequence<?> retval = argument.getSequenceType().getOccurrence().getSequenceHandler().handle(parameter);
125
126    // apply function conversion and type promotion to the parameter
127    if (!retval.isEmpty()) {
128      retval = convertSequence(argument, retval);
129
130      // verify resulting values
131      Class<? extends IItem> argumentClass = argument.getSequenceType().getType();
132      for (IItem item : retval.getValue()) {
133        Class<? extends IItem> itemClass = item.getClass();
134        if (!argumentClass.isAssignableFrom(itemClass)) {
135          throw new InvalidTypeMetapathException(
136              item,
137              String.format("The type '%s' is not a subtype of '%s'",
138                  TypeSystem.getName(itemClass),
139                  TypeSystem.getName(argumentClass)));
140        }
141      }
142    }
143    return retval;
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Based on XPath 3.1
148   * <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-31/#dt-function-conversion">function
149   * conversion</a> rules.
150   *
151   * @param argument
152   *          the function argument signature details
153   * @param sequence
154   *          the sequence to convert
155   * @return the converted sequence
156   */
157  @NonNull
158  protected static ISequence<?> convertSequence(@NonNull IArgument argument, @NonNull ISequence<?> sequence) {
159    ISequenceType requiredSequenceType = argument.getSequenceType();
160    Class<? extends IItem> requiredSequenceTypeClass = requiredSequenceType.getType();
161
162    Stream<? extends IItem> stream = sequence.safeStream();
163
164    if (IAnyAtomicItem.class.isAssignableFrom(requiredSequenceTypeClass)) {
165      Stream<? extends IAnyAtomicItem> atomicStream = stream.flatMap(FnData::atomize);
166
167      // if (IUntypedAtomicItem.class.isInstance(item)) { // NOPMD
168      // // TODO: apply cast to atomic type
169      // }
170
171      if (IStringItem.class.equals(requiredSequenceTypeClass)) {
172        // promote URIs to strings if a string is required
173        atomicStream = atomicStream.map(item -> IAnyUriItem.class.isInstance(item) ? IStringItem.cast(item) : item);
174      }
175
176      stream = atomicStream;
177    }
178
179    stream = stream.peek(item -> {
180      if (!requiredSequenceTypeClass.isInstance(item)) {
181        throw new InvalidTypeMetapathException(
182            item,
183            String.format("The type '%s' is not a subtype of '%s'",
184                item.getClass().getName(),
185                requiredSequenceTypeClass.getName()));
186      }
187    });
188    assert stream != null;
189
190    return ISequence.of(stream);
191  }
192
193  private IItem getContextItem(@NonNull ISequence<?> focus) {
194    IItem contextItem = null;
195    if (isFocusDepenent()) {
196      contextItem = focus.getFirstItem(true);
197      if (contextItem == null) {
198        throw new DynamicMetapathException(DynamicMetapathException.DYNAMIC_CONTEXT_ABSENT, "The context is empty");
199      }
200    }
201    return contextItem;
202  }
203
204  @Override
205  public ISequence<?> execute(
206      @NonNull List<? extends ISequence<?>> arguments,
207      @NonNull DynamicContext dynamicContext,
208      @NonNull ISequence<?> focus) {
209
210    try {
211      IItem contextItem = getContextItem(focus);
212
213      List<ISequence<?>> convertedArguments = convertArguments(this, arguments);
214
215      CallingContext callingContext = null;
216      ISequence<?> result = null;
217      if (isDeterministic()) {
218        // check cache
219        callingContext = new CallingContext(convertedArguments, contextItem);
220        // TODO: implement something like computeIfAbsent
221        // attempt to get the result from the cache
222        result = dynamicContext.getCachedResult(callingContext);
223      }
224
225      if (result == null) {
226        result = handler.execute(this, convertedArguments, dynamicContext, contextItem);
227
228        if (callingContext != null) {
229          // add result to cache
230          dynamicContext.cacheResult(callingContext, result);
231        }
232      }
233
234      // logger.info(String.format("Executed function '%s' with arguments '%s'
235      // producing result '%s'",
236      // toSignature(), convertedArguments.toString(), result.asList().toString()));
237      return result;
238    } catch (MetapathException ex) {
239      throw new MetapathException(String.format("Unable to execute function '%s'", toSignature()), ex);
240    }
241  }
242
243  @Override
244  public int hashCode() {
245    return Objects.hash(getQName(), getArguments(), handler, properties, result);
246  }
247
248  @Override
249  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
250    if (this == obj) {
251      return true; // NOPMD - readability
252    }
253    if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
254      return false; // NOPMD - readability
255    }
256    DefaultFunction other = (DefaultFunction) obj;
257    return Objects.equals(getQName(), other.getQName())
258        && Objects.equals(getArguments(), other.getArguments())
259        && Objects.equals(handler, other.handler)
260        && Objects.equals(properties, other.properties)
261        && Objects.equals(result, other.result);
262  }
263
264  @Override
265  public String toString() {
266    return toSignature();
267  }
268
269  public final class CallingContext {
270    @Nullable
271    private final IItem contextItem;
272    @NonNull
273    private final List<ISequence<?>> arguments;
274
275    /**
276     * Set up the execution context for this function.
277     *
278     * @param arguments
279     *          the function arguments
280     * @param contextItem
281     *          the current node context
282     */
283    private CallingContext(@NonNull List<ISequence<?>> arguments, @Nullable IItem contextItem) {
284      this.contextItem = contextItem;
285      this.arguments = arguments;
286    }
287
288    /**
289     * Get the function instance associated with the calling context.
290     *
291     * @return the function instance
292     */
293    @NonNull
294    public DefaultFunction getFunction() {
295      return DefaultFunction.this;
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Get the node item focus associated with the calling context.
300     *
301     * @return the function instance
302     */
303    @Nullable
304    public IItem getContextItem() {
305      return contextItem;
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Get the arguments associated with the calling context.
310     *
311     * @return the arguments
312     */
313    @NonNull
314    public List<ISequence<?>> getArguments() {
315      return arguments;
316    }
317
318    @Override
319    public int hashCode() {
320      final int prime = 31;
321      int result = 1;
322      result = prime * result + getFunction().hashCode();
323      return prime * result + Objects.hash(contextItem, arguments);
324    }
325
326    @Override
327    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
328      if (this == obj) {
329        return true; // NOPMD - readability
330      }
331      if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
332        return false; // NOPMD - readability
333      }
334      CallingContext other = (CallingContext) obj;
335      if (!getFunction().equals(other.getFunction())) {
336        return false; // NOPMD - readability
337      }
338      return Objects.equals(arguments, other.arguments) && Objects.equals(contextItem, other.contextItem);
339    }
340  }
341}
